property.name: hawq_master_address_host
property.description: The hostname of HAWQ master.

property.name: hawq_master_address_port
property.description: The port number of HAWQ master.

property.name: hawq_standby_address_host
property.description: The hostname of HAWQ standby.

property.name: hawq_segment_address_port
property.description: The port number of HAWQ segment.

property.name: hawq_dfs_url
property.description: URL for accessing HDFS.

property.name: hawq_master_directory
property.description: The directory of HAWQ master.

property.name: hawq_segment_directory
property.description: The directory of HAWQ segment.

property.name: hawq_master_temp_directory
property.description: The temporary directory reserved for HAWQ master.

property.name: hawq_segment_temp_directory
property.description: The temporary directory reserved for HAWQ segment.

property.name: hawq_global_rm_type
property.description: The resource manager to use for allocating resources. When set to Native ('none'), HAWQ resource manager exclusively uses whole cluster. When set to YARN ('yarn') HAWQ resource manager contacts YARN resource manager to negotiate resource.

property.name: hawq_rm_memory_limit_perseg
property.description: The limit of memory usage in a HAWQ segment when Resource Manager (hawq_global_rm_type) is set to Native ('none').

property.name: hawq_rm_nvcore_limit_perseg
property.description: The limit of virtual core usage in a HAWQ segment when Resource Manager (hawq_global_rm_type) is set to Native ('none').

property.name: hawq_rm_yarn_address
property.description: The address of YARN resource manager server.

property.name: hawq_rm_yarn_scheduler_address
property.description: The address of YARN scheduler server.

property.name: hawq_rm_yarn_queue_name
property.description: The YARN queue name to register HAWQ resource manager.

property.name: hawq_rm_yarn_app_name
property.description: The application name to register HAWQ resource manager in YARN.

property.name: hawq_re_cpu_enable
property.description: The control to enable/disable CPU resource enforcement.

property.name: hawq_re_cgroup_mount_point
property.description: The mount point of CGroup file system for resource enforcement. For example, /sys/fs/cgroup/cpu/hawq for CPU sub-system.

property.name: hawq_re_cgroup_hierarchy_name
property.description: The name of the hierarchy to accomodate CGroup directories/files for resource enforcement. For example, /sys/fs/cgroup/cpu/hawq for CPU sub-system.

property.name: default_segment_num
property.description: The default number of virtual segments to use when executing a query statement. When the query is actually executed, the number of virtual segments may differ from this number depending on the query's needs. When expanding the cluster, you should adjust this number to reflect the number of nodes in the new cluster times the number of virtual segments per node.
